attributes.magic: PE32+ executable (GUI) x86-64, for MS Windows

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell - PS Script
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject; Path=; ScriptBlockId=03b1c72a-0c3c-48e2-bac0-6ac6fc065b2a; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}
@{ScriptBlockText=Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=b97b91e9-d06b-4173-af36-54475ef5d502; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -Command "Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -Command "Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Load Of RstrtMgr.DLL By An Uncommon Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the load of RstrtMgr DLL (Restart Manager) by an uncommon process.
This library has been used during ransomware campaigns to kill processes that would prevent file encryption by locking them (e.g. Conti ransomware, Cactus ransomware). It has also recently been seen used by the BiBi wiper for Windows.
It could also be used for anti-analysis purposes by shut downing specific processes.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=BBC636E6DCA39D77544CAA4016C5A683E03867D0,MD5=18C0F58E20C77985448E60BFB1BB50CF,SHA256=BF4ABBD6C8493A43E135ED4B711F0FC77B9677B72045AC61B9F771A092E2D842,IMPHASH=CBDADB3F19BC8DB3336F30AC5B098004; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; OriginalFileName=RstrtMgr.dll; ImageLoaded=C:\Windows\System32\RstrtMgr.dll; Description=Restart Manager; SignatureStatus=Valid; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); EventID=7; Signed=true; Signature=Microsoft Windows; Image=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\win.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factors were that it has known exploits and it could not be run in sandboxes.
